conclusion: To determine the changes in the position of the shadows A, B, C, and D when the light source moves to the back left above the objects.
The image shows four objects (paper, mirror, ring, avocado) with shadows labeled A, B, C, and D cast on the ground.
Shadow A is currently cast to the front right of the paper object.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow A will shift to the front right, extending further from the object.
Shadow B is currently cast to the front right of the mirror object.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow B will shift to the front right, extending further from the object.
Shadow C is currently cast to the back right of the ring object.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow C will shift to the front left, extending further from the object.
Shadow D is currently cast to the back right of the avocado object.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow D will shift to the front left, extending further from the object.
The shadows will generally move in the opposite direction of the light source shift.
The shadows will lengthen as the angle of the light changes.
Shadow A will move to the front right.
Shadow B will move to the front right.
Shadow C will move to the front left.
Shadow D will move to the front left.
The image provided shows the shadows shifting in the expected directions.
